St._Paul.Finch, Vanslyck, and McConville Dry Good: The Finch, Vanslyck and McConville Dry Goods Company Building is a classical revival industrial building designed by James E. Denson, built by George Grant Construction Company, in 1911 and 1923; it is part of Lowertown Historic District in Saint Paul, Minnesota, United States. It fronts Mears Park and is currently used as residential apartments. It is listed on the National Register of Historic Places.
